column5: I'm sorry, Columbus got here before me, although some say the Vikings beat him to it.

I got here because my father wasn't a Mexican citizen, so he couldn't practice there, and he had no desire to return to fascist Spain. He was working for the US Govt. at the time and they got him permanent residency. Coincidentally, his third option was Canada but my mother couldn't bear the thought of the cold. Three years later we ended up in Michigan anyway.

Grew up in Omaha, Ne, it was a big little town then, but two years ago, moved to Michigan!!! Had too, when the state rejected a Congressional Medal of Honor Winner, who was also the best governor and senator the state EVER had, in favor of a wealthy rancher's wife,who had never done a thing and had no experience whatsoever, it was time to take my money and move OUT of the red state!!! By the way the ex-governor was of the blue variety. I'm a 64 year old Marine and the whole thing made me PUKE
HEY NOW...They've been providing 2 1/2 to 3 quarters of quality football in every game for years. As a matter of fact, they lead the league in several vital stats: Arrests and Convictions

Sorry but the US deserves equal time, way back when (in the 80s) I lived in Thunder Bay Ontario and our salmon fishing was poor so a group of us headed down to fish Hovland and Grand Marais in Minnesota and had a blast, fishing was great and the people were great too. Now adays I make a trip to Port Clinton Ohio for a week walleye fishing and again fish with a great group of guys and the people are great.
I discovered the USA when Dr. Fredricks delivered me at Mahaska Hospital in Oskaloosa Iowa on July 25, 1945. I have enjoyed every day since. Mike Kansas

My old man was a lobster fisherman up on PEI and my mom, from Bar Harbor, spent many summers up there with Gramps. Well she got knocked up one summer and Pops married her. Lasted 3 years. Anyway, Dad came to Michigan in the 60's/70's to guide Salmon fisherman and I got the bug during one of my stays. Moved in with him when I was 15. I rarely fish Salmon anymore, mostly Walleye and Perch. Less monkey business.

Wow, for a split second I thought Gramps was going to jail.... How did I discover the U.S.? Growing up in Winnipeg it was an annual migration of "tobans" to the shopping mecca of Grand Forks, N.D.......where we would wear all our new purchases crossing the border back into Canada to avoid paying the duty. Probably instilled my dislike for shopping and veered me into fishing. I now declare everything at the border.
Running down to buy affordable gas and groceries and receive decent health care!?!
Nope....just investigating why everyone was running north for outstanding fishing!
You got me Gord. I trust you could sense the kidding.
Of course! I knew you weren't serious....you forgot to mention the cheap booze!
same date for me. same state. different year!
@mike Kansas Born in oskaloosa!!!!! This explains much!!!!
